New Forest Clown Lab

Starting in November 2025, I’ll be leading a fortnightly Clown workshop in Brockenhurst, New Forest, open to both beginners and professionals. These are drop-in classes rooted in the traditions of Lecoq and Gaulier. It can be exhilirating, it can be stupid, it can be frightening, but regardless of your background and experience it will be fun and useful.

It’s pay-what-you-can (suggested donation £10), held every two weeks at the Brockenhurst Village Hub — a five-minute walk from the station, with easy trains from Bournemouth and Southampton, and plenty of parking.

What to Expect

Whether you’re brand new to this style or a world famous superstar clown, these workshops are a place to hone your instincts, refine your timing, and find what works on stage.

We’ll explore games and exercises, some all together, some in smaller groups or solo. We'll be moving around a lot so wear clothes you can move in. Red noses are sometimes required, sometimes not - I'll provide some, but feel free to bring your own.

Who's Leading It?

The sessions are led by me, James Carney, a Lecoq-trained performer and theatre-maker with years of experience in clown, mask, and physical theatre.

Location

Brockenhurst Village Hub (Craft Room)

Highwood Road, Brockenhurst, Hampshire, SO42 7RY

Upcoming Dates

  • Wednesday 5th November 2025 – 7:30pm–9:30pm
  • Wednesday 19th November 2025 – 7:30pm–9:30pm
  • Wednesday 3th December 2025 – 7:30pm–9:30pm
  • Wednesday 17th December 2025 – 7:30pm–9:30pm

How to Join

No need to book—just turn up. If you'd like to get in touch or ask a question, message @NewForestClownLab on Instagram or drop me an email.

Unseen Things, Lyndhurst, England, United Kingdom
